page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: There are many various types and styles of housing to be found in our block. The old village part of North Hykeham has many old houses that are built of stone. Many older properties that have become derelict are now being modernised as Hykeham is a popular residential area, especially the old village part. Tere are a number of detached and semi-detached houses built in brick that date from the 1900's. Most of these have large gardens as it was common then that people woulg grow a lot of their own food. Most of the modern houses (1970- ) have small gardens. Most modern property built has been of the bungalow type built by D.W.Bocock, although his plans for a new estate at the bottom of Water Lane includes many houses of an 'Elizabethan' and 'Tudor' style.
